attributes.action: Intervene in the slaughter of stray dogs in Russia preceding the 2018 World Cup.
attributes.background: The 2018 FIFA Football World Cup will take place in Russia in June and July. In an attempt to “ensure security and a pleasant stay” and “provide a good image” for visitors, thousands of stray cats and dogs and even birds in host cities are being killed.
attributes.additional_details:
Russia lacks a humane system of shelters, food and medical support for homeless cats and dogs. However, contracts worth $1.95million have been signed in host cities to kill the animals rather than set up shelters or provide spay/neuter and vaccinations programmes. 

Russia must withdraw all contracts and cancel planned slaughter of hundreds of thousands of animals.  

WE ASK OUR GOVERNMENT: Contact the Russian Government and demand the passing of animal protection laws and redirect any foreign aid to support humane solutions to remove stray animals from the streets.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/bloodyFIFA2018/

attributes.action: Abolish workplace parking charges for NHS staff
attributes.background: These people dedicate their lives to helping the sick and vulnerable and are often poorly paid . It seems extremely unfair that they should be charged for attending work.

attributes.action: Councils should be able to nominate people to a different council for downsizing
attributes.background: The Government should extend the Right to Move to tenants who want to downsize. There are so many council tenants under occupying properties that bigger families desperately need.
attributes.additional_details: All councils & housing associations should be giving tenants an incentive to move out of these bigger properties, like allowing a tenant to be nominated to a borough of the tenants choice. Local authorities shouldn’t be allowed to apply a local connection test if it could disadvantage tenants who need or want to move across local authority boundaries to downsize.

attributes.action: Protect workers while in their Probationary period within an employment contract
attributes.background:
Currently the employment law does not protect employees during the probationary period of a new contract. 
An employer can dismiss the member of staff without reason within this period with no review and the employee has no legal right to challenge it. 
I feel this needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government needs to protect employees by making sure that a review meeting, through the period should be carried out allowing time to improve. 
Also if at the end of the probationary period the employer feels the employee is not suitable then a reason must be given following guidelines. 
The government should make it illegal to dismiss anyone without given support to improve or a reason why they are being dismissed. 
This is currently allowed to happen giving workers no protection

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all cyclists to wear reflective jackets in the dark.
attributes.background: I frequently drive in the dark during the Autumn/Winter months and have noticed how frequently I pass cyclists that are not wearing anything reflective. To ensure the safety of cyclists and of drivers, I feel that it should be compulsory for them to wear a reflective jacket in the dark.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the cyclists I pass in the Autumn/Winter months wear dark clothing and rely on a small bicycle light to make them noticeable to drivers. It is not safe and it is not helpful. I feel that these cyclists are putting their own lives at risk by not wearing reflective clothing and by not doing so, also putting drivers at risk. I feel quite strongly about this, mostly because the reflective jackets are not expensive, so there is no excuse not to wear one.

attributes.action: To also be seen as a breach of contact when a father doesn’t show up to contact
attributes.background: I have a child arrangement order in place with my ex partner which states I have to make my child  available for contact if I do not I am breaching the court order and can be fined or even imprisoned yet if he doesnt show the court don’t see that as a breach
attributes.additional_details: I feel it is only fair that if the court orders things in a child arrangement order and it must be abided by law by myself then also my ex partner should be treated the same in the event of repeatedly not bothering to show up especially with no explanation. I feel it is only fair in this day and age that both parties in the situation be treated/punished equally in the event of breaking contact which has been ordered by the court.

attributes.action: Encourage greater use of driverless trains by TOCs across the UK rail network.
attributes.background: TOCs' greatest cost is the wages of train drivers. Driverless trains have existed in the UK for decades, yet only a minority of the network use them. Driverless trains would increase efficiencies, make TOCs profitable, reduce the need for government subsidy, and enable a reduction in ticket prices.
attributes.additional_details:
- Automated de/acceleration patters help energy recovery and savings, making trains more environmentally friendly
- Drivers are no longer involved in monotonous tasks of driving a train. Some can be re-qualified and deployed along the line, providing more customer service and fewer staff-less stations
- Average speed of the system can increase
- 32 cities globally use fully automated metro systems
- Ticket prices and govt subsidies are unnecessarily high due to extortionate drivers wages

attributes.action: Ensure HMI inspectors inspecting SEN schools have sufficient experience in SEN
attributes.background: From both personal experience and talks with others educational professionals, the majority of OFSTED inspectors who grade special schools have insufficient knowledge of SEN or more shockingly, none.

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid to £2B and use the balance for UK Defence and Public Services.
attributes.background: The Foreign Aid budget of  0.7% of GDP is an arbitrary target which sees the UK actually borrow money to then give it away to foreign countries. At a time of such worldwide insecurity, this money would be much better spent on the UK's Armed Forces and on helping the NHS & other Public Services.

attributes.action: Lower Import duty on classic car parts from the USA.
attributes.background: Many small car/garage businesses in the UK rely on classic car parts and associated services from the USA but many struggle financially  due to the amount of duty paid. We ask Parliament to either abolish it on classic car parts or lower it to a reasonable level, with clear rules on its application
attributes.additional_details: There have been numberous instances where we have sent car parts for engineering work in the USA having already imported it from the USA only to be charged import duty again on the parts return to the UK. The rules are evidently either unfair or unclear to those applying them. Your urgent attention to this matter would be greatly appreciated.

attributes.action: Make sure that development of new drugs is not adversely affected by BREXIT.
attributes.background: The Government must commit to following the current process for all drugs already in the EU clinical trial and approval pipeline.
attributes.additional_details:
Doctors and drug companies work in many countries to develop a drug.  Drugs in development now will be in Clinical Trial both before and after March 2019.

Bodies like the European Medicines Agency regulate drug approval with a single set of regulations and approval steps. 

Developing effective treatments for debilitating diseases will greatly reduce the long-term financial and social cost to the UK.

https://www.ft.com/content/e3e9ac6a-5f2d-11e7-8814-0ac7eb84e5f1

attributes.action: Ban the use of lead in all shotgun cartridges
attributes.background: The lead in shotgun cartridges is poisoning our environment. This leads to the slow death of many species of birds. Albeit shot birds that are consumed by predatory birds and scavengers or birds ingesting them mistakenly taken as grit. There are many alternatives available to use.

attributes.action: Post study work visa should be introduced again for tier4 international students
attributes.background: Post study work visa was valid till 2012. Now winning a lottery might be an easy task for an international student  ( that too is not a good example because of no public funds clause) but getting a job with tier 2 specifications is a nightmare for the students who arrive here on loans and much more.

attributes.action: Save the UK FM Radio Signal
attributes.background:
In the next few years the UK’s analogue radio signal will be switched off and listeners will have to tune into digital radio instead.

The UK is NOT ready. FM sounds better and has better signal. DAB sounds tinny and car DAB signal drops out. 

PLEASE SAVE THE UK FM RADIO SIGNAL.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people will not be used to DAB systems and will already own FM capable technology and would struggle to make the change.

Older but perfectly usable stereo systems will become obsolete and people may not be able to afford new equipment.

The FM signal is a historic achievement and it works. Future generations will miss out on learning of radio frequencies.

A strong FM signal provides excellent sound quality for both music and speech, whereas DAB is significantly inferior.

attributes.action: Condemn the military action against ethnic Kurds by Iran and Iraq.
attributes.background: After the decision by the people of Kurdistan for independence in a referendum, retaliatory force by the Iranian backed militia and the Iraqi army against Kurdish populations in Kirkuk have resulted in dispossession and ethnically motivated crime.

attributes.action: Abolish the annual Rod Licence for anglers in England and Wales
attributes.background: More than a million freshwater anglers in England and Wales (not Scotland) pay an annual fee for a (fishing) Rod Licence. This is a tax on angling. Yet there is no licence needed to walk the same river, nor to visit our National Parks, nor to climb a mountain or bicycle on our roads.
attributes.additional_details: Income from licences is falling. Between 2010 and 2016 a drop of 12.6%. Income down from £25.4m to £22.2m. Dr. Broughton at the ATA has collated data over the last six years. •You don't need a licence in Scotland or for sea fishing. •It is unfair anglers have to buy a licence to enjoy a legal hobby when no others who make an equal claim on natural resources do •Anglers spend £1.2bn annually; that is £240m in VAT income alone. Abolition is likely to see participation increase

attributes.action: Make Northumberland Scottish land
attributes.background: I think that Scotland should rightfully own Northumberland. This is because Northumberland and Scotland share a similar culture and have strong ethnic ties. I believe this may help with the economy and natural resources as Northumberland has a lot of coal.
attributes.additional_details: Back in 2014/2015 many petitions were made for Northumberland to once again join Scotland. Many news articles reported on this. However, the people who signed those petitions did not get their wish. We have a shared history and culture. The UK Government in London doesn't govern Northumberland very well.

attributes.action: Stop councils charging for DIY waste at recycling sites.
attributes.background: The relevant government department has stated that these charges should not be imposed. Any discouragement to the proper disposal of DIY waste will contribute to the increase in fly tipping.

attributes.action: Increase pedestrian crossing times to enable disabled people to cross safely
attributes.background:
Often when I wait to cross the road and the green man appears, it goes off again whilst I'm only halfway through crossing - and I'm an able bodied person.

My father has MS and walks with a stick, meaning he and many other disabled people are not provided with enough time to safely cross the road.

attributes.action: Reinstate AS levels for sixth form students (aged 16-18) in the UK
attributes.background: As of 2015, the AS level (examined in Year 1 &2)  has been removed in place of a ‘linear Alevel’ structure (examined Y2)  - How are students expected to retain all 2 years worth of content whilst completing UCAS, working, doing extra curricular activities and maintaining their mental health ?
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/pupils-exam-stress-rising-dramatically-new-figures-show%3famp

attributes.action: the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards" to British citizens
attributes.background: Many British citizens, while staying in other European countries, risk being fined for failing to carry a national identity card or passport, because the British passport is insufficiently small or durable to carry at all times. Therefore the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards".

attributes.action: Freedom of Information Act should apply to any company working for the Govt.
attributes.background: There are many Private sector companies that have accepted a contract from either Local or Central Government. They are receiving tax payers money, yet are providing no transparency to the public. Its time for these companies to be included in the the current FOI.

attributes.action: Give PCV Cat D drivers Cat C (HGV) entitlement
attributes.background:
Currently there is a shortage of Cat C HGV drivers if Cat D entitled drivers were given Cat C status this would help close the shortfall. 
Cat D & C test are almost the same and the vehicles have the same characteristics in movement.

attributes.action: The Nursing & Midwifery Council (NMC) should be a tax-payer funded organisation
attributes.background:
The NMC has been an independent regulatory body, funded by Nurse's & Midwives. 
The main aim of the NMC is to protect patients, whilst regulating practice of Nurse’s and Midwives.
I feel the NMC should be funded by the tax-paying public and not by N&M's, like the Health & Safety Executive is.
attributes.additional_details:
The NMC recently decided to pay their staff an 11% annual pay rise & we are still fighting to get above 1%!
In September 2017, it was reported by the BBC News Online: Fourteen unions joined together to ask for the increase, (3.9%!!), saying pay has fallen by 15% since 2010, once inflation was taken into account. 
How can the NMC justify a £120 annual retention fee, to an organisation, whose primary remit is to protect patients, & have got a massive pay rise?? 
I have colleagues using food banks!

attributes.action: A total ban on hunting for sport including the digging out of foxes and badgers!
attributes.background: Hunting for sport in the 21st century is both barbaric and cruel. Just because it's tradition doesn't make it right! It's not just the wildlife that suffers, dogs and horses suffer as well!

attributes.action: Assault on emergency service workers   must  carry a term of imprisonment!
attributes.background: Assaults on emergency service workers, i.e. police, fire personnel, paramedic and nurses are too frequently dealt with by caution or suspended sentences. Suspects must be prosecuted and. if convicted, receive an immediate custodial sentence of at least 6 months.

attributes.action: Bring forward the 2020 London Mayoral Elections to 2019.
attributes.background: The 2020 London mayoral elections should be brought forward from 2020 to 2019 in order to de-conflict with a possible general election also due 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
The current London assembly is running with the idea that the election should be delayed until 2021 because of the chance of a general election in the same year (2020). This will give the current mayor an extra 12 months in power without being re-elected.

Londoners should be given the opportunity to select a new mayor sooner rather than later. The people of London must be given the chance to rid themselves of the massive increase in crime associated with the current mayor.

attributes.action: Restrict child benefit to the first two children in a family
attributes.background: The population of the world generally and of the UK specifically is growing at an alarming rate. The government should not be subsidising parents who choose to have larger families. It is therefore proposed that child benefit should be capped at two children per family

attributes.action: Take freight off our roads and onto an improved Railway Freight system.
attributes.background: Governments worldwide are making great strides to protect the environment, yet the pioneers of Rail travel ignore the benefits of an updated Freight system that would take thousands of lorries and vans off UK roads and motorways. Saving Billions of pounds in road repairs and accidents.

attributes.action: Ban the testing of household cleaning product ingredients on animals.
attributes.background: There is no law in the UK that bans the testing of cleaning products on animals. This is a cruel practice with no practical use whatsoever. I urge you to please sign this petition if you , like me love animals and do not want to see them suffer.

attributes.action: Add red hair colour to the protected characteristics of the Equality Act.
attributes.background: Stop cruel comments with insinuations that being a red head is unfortunate ugly and embarrassing.That a person deserves to be bullied because there a red head.
attributes.additional_details: Taunting red heads seems to be the last socially accepted freebie in society, yet it's impact can be as devastating to the receiver as any person covered in the discrimination act. Abuse ranges from name calling which leads to low self esteem and depression. Most disturbing suicide. Serious assaults have occurred just for being a red head. A red head can't change the colour of hair. Like a person can't change their skin colour, sexual orientation or disability.  It can't continue. It's not "OK".

attributes.action: Make the Treasury remove the VAT on fuel duty
attributes.background: If you buy fuel at £1.229 per litre, petrol or diesel, are you aware that 11.59 pence of the total VAT on the fuel you purchase is actually a tax upon the fuel duty, which is also a government tax on fuel!!!
attributes.additional_details: If the VAT on the fuel duty is removed, then the £1.229p cost of fuel will reduce to £1.02p!!!!

attributes.action: Put additional stamp duty on international buyers
attributes.background: Foreign buyers have driven the demands of our properties. This is making properties prices higher and higher. This needs to be controlled. A lots of properties that foreign buyers own remain empty as well.

attributes.action: Let the people decide whether Brexit included the single market & customs union
attributes.background: This petition requires the UK Governemnt to clarify by public vote before March 2018 whether the intention of referendum voters was to leave membership of the EU only, or also to leave the single market and customs union and related institutions as extrapolated by the UK Government.

attributes.action: Improve safety and quality of our road network and reduce congestion
attributes.background: 1.Starting in driving schools by ensuring there is more attention on teaching safe driving on motorways and dual carriage ways. We think that driving on these types of roads requires techniques that are not well emphasised by current training methods.
attributes.additional_details:
Improvement could be achieved if new drivers would be taught of correct speed selection, acceleration and keeping left when not overtaking. 
2.Improving existing roads by installing more signs to remind drivers of simple rules such as:
-Keep left when not overtaking (middle lane hogging)
-Keep your distance

attributes.action: Provide victims of the most severe sexual crimes anonymity throughout trial.
attributes.background: Currently victims of crimes under the Sexual Offences (Amendment) Act 1992 are given lifetime anonymity from the media. Despite attempts to fully provide protection during trial details of the victims name are made available to the accused; even in cases of serious sexual assault by a stranger.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls for other means of identifying victims such as pseudonym, case number or photo to be considered.
 
Sexual assaults are crimes of power and control, a name is a key part of personal identity so giving the accused the victim’s name adds to the assault. Much of what you do or are is linked to your name, having it makes it easy to identify, locate or contact someone.
 
Using a victim’s name within courts would seem to contravene Article 8 of the Human Rights Act.

attributes.action: Legislate to ban fast food delivery riders from working without a full license.
attributes.background: Fast food delivery riders are under pressure to deliver as soon as possible, in some cases they have a set time, or lose money.  They can get on a moped with no training or experience.  All that is required is a provisional licence and a set of ‘l plates’.
attributes.additional_details: Riders can be seen throughout the UK weaving  and zigzagging through traffic, overtaking and squeezing through almost impossible spaces, in a kamikaze like attempt to deliver and get back to base and be on the road again. This gets worse when other delivery riders are near.  Intense rivalry between companies and even colleagues makes for dangerous situations.

attributes.action: Clothing shops to have full disabled access and disabled changing facilities
attributes.background: Many stores in the UK don’t have disabiled access and unsutiable changing facilities for people with disabilities. I would like the government to introduce legislation that would make it compulsory for all clothing stores to have disabled changing facilities.

attributes.action: Spend at least 60 billion pounds every year in Defense by 2020
attributes.background: We, as well as British and US military officials, ask that the UK government increases the armed forces defense budget so we are able to protect our country from states such as Russia and North Korea. We must stop cuts to our armed forces at this critical time, to counter the threats that face today
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-41903960

attributes.action: Allow citizens to raise concerns about M.P.s' behaviour during Commons' Debates
attributes.background: M.P.s may raise a Point of Order during a House of Commons’ sitting if they think that an M.P. has said something offensive or inappropriate during a Commons' Debate.  There is no way for members of the public to do this.
attributes.additional_details: Members of the public should be able to raise a matter of concern with the Speaker, who should be required to report it to the House (as was tradition, such as in the case of the Imprisonment for Default of Mr. S. Saklatvala, M.P., in May 1926).

attributes.action: Put Dropped Kerbs REQUIRED in Law into the Highways Acts, At this time it is Not
attributes.background: A number today just do their own thing on the Highways causing Areas to look Run Down, All Properties that want a Drive ‘Must Have A Dropped Kerb’ and a Tarmac Area to their Boundary, this would keep things in Order and Controlled, some put items in the gutter to get over it, Dangerous to Cyclists.
attributes.additional_details:
Some Property Owners Churn Up the Grass Verges causing issues with Mud Displacement onto Footpaths which the Council has to Clean Up st Cost, if it was Law to have a Dropped Kerb none of these issues would arise, believe anyone doing so can Get Blocked in as there is No drive in Law, if Written into the Highways Acts would clean up the Highways in General, also stop these putting things into the gutters to get over the Kerbs and keep them free from any Obstruction.

Should be common sense.

attributes.action: Allow under 40s to access their pension pot in order to buy their first house.
attributes.background: Young people are struggling to raise the funds to but their first home, yet they can have enough money for a deposit in their pension funds. The simplest solution being that younger people should be able to access their pension funds purely for use as a deposit for their first home.

attributes.action: Start teaching a language thoroughly from the school year of reception (age 4/5)
attributes.background: Teaching a language from primary school level is not yet compulsory at key stage 1, which is a major part of a child’s development. If taught thoroughly from a younger age, the more likely a child is to remember the language, which will also help in their working future.
attributes.additional_details: A DfE representative found that there is no requirement to teach languages in all years in KS2, as long as the content of the programme of study has been covered by the end of KS2. The UK needs a multilingual population in order to succeed in a globalised world, for global citizenship, security and to operate efficiently in trade and investment. The research, commissioned by the British Council, also revealed that UK schoolchildren are now less likely to speak a foreign language than those in any other European nation.

attributes.action: Remove Parental Responsibility if convicted of paedophilia & domestic violence
attributes.background: Apart from financially supporting their children, people convicted of paedophilia or domestic violence should have no further parental responsibility for them. Both domestically violent people and paedophiles should not be able to utilise courts to continue their control.
attributes.additional_details:
Protect the survivor, protect the children.

The HEAL Foundation asks the Government to rescind parental responsibility from both domestically violent people and paedophiles. If someone is convicted for domestic violence, the judge should rescind their Parental Responsibility rights so the abusive party cannot use the courts to continue their control. Judges should end Parental Responsibility permanently for convicted paedophiles.

attributes.action: No more speed humps and better sequencing of traffic lights for cleaner air
attributes.background:
Traffic calming measures might be reducing the chance of an accident, but they increase pollution
Cars repeatedly slowing down and speeding up, which almost doubles the amount of harmful gases and particles they emit. Not to mention break dust
Green wave for drivers driving within the speed limit
attributes.additional_details:
It should be a better way to keep the traffic slow and steady.
Cameras could be installed in 20mph zones to keep the cars slow and steady.
It should be speed cameras in front of every school and pedestrian crossing as well.
Traffic lights should be better sequenced as well (green wave) to protect that drivers will keep arriving at green lights rather than red ones if they drive within the speed limit

attributes.action: Remove MFL as a mandatory subject and allow students to chose if they take MFL
attributes.background: Plenty of students time is wasted learning a modern foreign language they have no interest in learning. Students should be allowed to pick if they take Modern Foreign Languages. Students should chose spend in a subject they have no interest in rather than wasting money and time of schools.

attributes.action: Introduce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia
attributes.background: The Saudi state is notorious for its unjust and frankly disgusting treatment of women and LGBT people. It also massively restricts the civil liberties of its entire population. There is also evidence that suggests Saudi donors sponsor terrorism. We cannot support governments of this sort.
attributes.additional_details:
From gov.uk: 
"It’s illegal for women to drive."
"Homosexual acts and extra-marital sexual relations, including adultery, are illegal and can be subject to severe penalties."
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge"

A series of leaks from the then-Secretary of State Hillary Clinton's emails suggested that Saudi donors fund extremism.
A number of mosques found to be preaching extremist Wahhabism have been said to be linked to Saudi organisations.

attributes.action: Make the motor trade require a licence to be a mechanic
attributes.background: The motor trade unlike all other trades doesn't require a licence for the tradesmen and women to work. Garages can employ anybody as a mechanic. Unlike plumbers for example who need licences to work. A licence would ensure mechanics are capable of doing the job to a reasonable standard and safely.

attributes.action: Drop 4 of the 5 law changes that will affect UK motorists due later in 2018
attributes.background:
There are 5 motoring law changes that will affect the motorists of UK due to come into effect later in the year of 2018.

The new laws that this petition is against cover:
1. New driver restrictions, 2. Changes to VED for diesel cars, 3. MOT changes, 4. Leaner Drivers on motorways.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see this article by DriveTribe for further information as linked below.

https://drivetribe.com/p/five-law-changes-that-will-affect-Utdk30x1QSOK_59b7U6Wfw?iid=Ifgt4G3vSGC2VK9QA6F34A&utm_campaign=idiotukdrivers&utm_medium=fb&utm_source=network

attributes.action: Amend class size legislation rule
attributes.background:
We lost our appeal to place our son in the closest school because of class size legislation 
His Dad is disabled and can't walk more than 200 metres and doesn't drive
The new school is 2 miles away so doesn't qualify for assistance there is no bus service or proper pavement
attributes.additional_details:
All relevant Doctors, Stroke Spealist and nuerologist reports were included and ignored His Disability award was provided 
The closet school mentioned it would make sense for our son to be allowed based on Dad's health. The rule was upheld above my child's safety and my husbands disability. 
Fundamentally this rule needs to be changed, forcing a disabled parent to travel further so his child can be educated is unacceptable if he can't get there. My child will walk 4 miles a day he is 5yrs old.
